remarks: In a Hausdorff topology, two continuous functions which agree on a dense set agree everywhere.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 28-Dec-2017.)
statement:
hauseqcn.x $e |- X = U. J $.
hauseqcn.k $e |- ( ph -> K e. Haus ) $.
hauseqcn.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( J Cn K ) ) $.
hauseqcn.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. ( J Cn K ) ) $.
hauseqcn.e $e |- ( ph -> ( F |` A ) = ( G |` A ) ) $.
hauseqcn.a $e |- ( ph -> A C_ X ) $.
hauseqcn.c $e |- ( ph -> ( ( cls ` J ) ` A ) = X ) $.
hauseqcn $p |- ( ph -> F = G ) $.
